turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I mean Walter owns the Sox, cable sports... most girls in her spot would be angling to get Daddy to offer you some juicy gig right here in t...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: She would never.  Never.  Even think of that.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I guess you're right.  That would be deceitful... manipulative... controlling... emascula...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I got the point.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Still.  All's fair in love and w...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: That would be a girl.  I don't even know.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You're not eating.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I never eat when I'm serene.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You never eat when you're despondent.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I switched that around when you weren't looking.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Last zoo we were in was... Beijing, yeah?  Sure.  The rhinos were fucking.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Boy, those were the days.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's weird being the groom.  All these things Kimmy has to take care of...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You need a baby-sitter.  That's what I'm here for.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Wow and wow.  You have a date, after this?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Never can tell.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Why don't you start being honest for one fucking sec...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Michael!!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No problem.  A little bullshit about Daddy's "needs," and presto, I'm a lap dog in high society.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Michael, it sounds like a wonderful opportun...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Does it, really? How come you never took some sell-out establishment job? You had plenty of chances!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You guys are heartless, my bride picked this out.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Like I said, dazzling.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Big weddings are so strange.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You keep saying that.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Kim has all this stuff to do, I hardly see her.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Well, you've got the rest of your lives.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You miss her, huh?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No.  I've got you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Don't you throw up on boat?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: If you like.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I've been thinking a lot the last couple days.  About us, actually.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Have you.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Well.  There's a lot of memories to choose from...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's more than that.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You've sort of been... y'know, the woman in my life.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You've been the man in mine.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: And I was thinking this could be our last time.  Alone.  Together. You know?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Except for the hot affairs we'll have twice a year.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Except for that.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I can hardly wait for your wedding.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Me either.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I wouldn't know.  I never had that many first thoughts.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I mean, you commit to a wedding. And then it seems like... this... momentum, you know?  You forget you... chose it.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Dance card filled?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I'll check.  I have it on powerbook, these days.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Where did we first hear th...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: The night we met.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: So we heard it... like, right that... that first...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: We danced to it.  Just like this.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Takes me back.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Well.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: No accents today.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Yeah, Kim told me they were giving you their Dueling Scarlet's act.  Actually, they're sophomores at Juilliard.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Will she like it?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's no big deal, she just gave you the wrong keys that's s...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ISN'T THERE A GUARD?  A JANITOR? A FUCKING CLEANING WOMAN? I'LL TAKE A BURGLAR!  SOMEBODY'S GOTTA BE IN TH...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I'm up against a deadline.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Me, too.  I'm getting married tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: That's my point!!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I forgot how cute you look.  When you get impossible.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: It's just... up there... right in front of Walter's... y'know, computer. If memory serves.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: We could use... his computer, to... just E-mail those suckers right ou...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Tomorrow is Sunday.  Nobody's doing business.  Crack of dawn, Monday, Walter'll take you up there...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Listen up, huh? Even if you blow this deal, how big could it be?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You're right.  Easy come, easy go.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: This thing means that much to y...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: It means a lot.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The fax is from Ben, too.  Man, it's my wedding, and my boss can't leave me alone...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... maybe it's congratulations.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Michael? What ha...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Mike.  I can't believe I'm doing this to you on the night before your wedding.  But I think you need and deserve to know...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Isabelle?  I need to talk to Kim...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: "Mike, the funny thing is, he's offering you a gig you'd be stupid to turn down..."

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm just tired.  Please put her on?  Thanks.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: "Maybe you should take the job. And dump the girl."

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's over.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: She denied it.  Said I was crazy and paranoid.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: A bad combination.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Michael...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: No, it's for the best, it really is.  We were so wrong for each other.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Maybe tomorrow, you'll feel dif...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The job thing would have broken us up, eventually, anyway.  She couldn't have lived with it.  I know that now.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Should we take a walk?  Or maybe some food sent up, or something...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I just want to be alone.  Is that okay?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Or we'll go somewhere.  If you have the time.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: If San Antonio sweeps Sacramento...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I had the craziest dream last night?  Walter and Kimmy had asked your boss to...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Look, I came down here to face everybody.  I didn't want to slink away like some coward...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: But the Scotch salmon was so fucking good, you decided to stay for brunch!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: She hasn't told anybody, what am I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Get married, apparently.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: This is her family and her fault.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: And your point?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Well.  How come she didn't...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: BECAUSE SHE'S AS CHICKENSHIT AS YOU ARE, YOU MORONS ARE MADE FOR EACH OTHER.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I asked you...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: She admits it's her fault.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Does that make it right...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Love doesn't have to be right. It just has to be love.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Thank God you were here.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Oh, yeah.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I was so confused, so conflicted, so... unstable.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Well, it happens.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... your one chance for true happiness?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: ... yeah, that.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You never want to do that, see, that's always a... costly turnover.  As they say in the sport biz.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: The Big Hurt, huh?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Nellie Fox.  Walter likes the past.  And he likes the little guys.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Shhh.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Jules, what's wrong...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: This is the dumbest thing I will ever do.  So dumb, in fact, that I can't.  I don't think.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Uh.  I saw that moving...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: DON'T SPEAK!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You're not saying you actually... you're saying that y...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... wrote it, yeah.  I'm the bad guy.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: ARE YOU CRAZY?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I mean, do you realize what you've... well, of course you realize, that's why you're confessing, I mean... I mean... how could you do that?

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I didn't know it would get sent.  I just wanted you to... get mad at Kimmy... and...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Actually.  Lower.  I am the fungus that feeds on pond scum.  Lower. The layer of mucous that cruds up the fung...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Lower.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Lower.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The pus that infects the mucous that cruds up the fungus.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: I'm so glad you didn't jump on that train, before...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I came here, looking for her.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Why would she come here...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: This is where I proposed.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I never forgot that.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: It's two weeks.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Almost three.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: That is so romantic.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: You can't believe you've lost her!  Sooner or later, you'll find her, and you'll look in each other's eyes, and you'll see all that love...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Course, if it's later rather than sooner, I'd hate to be you at six o'clock.  You've got a lot of explaining to...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm just thinking of how she's hurting.  Lost.  Alone.  Like her life is over.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: That's little egotistical.

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: Okay, we'll split up.  You go to every romantic place you guys have, I'll go... someplace brilliant, and the first one who...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: If you find her...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: The kiss.  May be hard.  For you to explain.  Because the only fear she really has, is...

turns.speaker: JULIANNE
turns.text: ... me, yeah.  And she likes Tommy Lasorda.  Case closed.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Well, the school will be here. Architecture will still be around. Right now...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I travel every week.  College ball, motor sports, training camps...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: The most important thing. Is being together.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Because I could come...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: To the twins' soiree?  So they can paw you and drool...?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: It's not just a gag, huh?

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: No, it's, uh... a real big favor.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: He never mentioned that.  Neither did y...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: ... and public relations is a big problem area for him.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: He needs someone incredible, someone really close, who he can trust...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Like family, huh?

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: It would only be, maybe, six months? Or three or four? It would mean so much to him...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: To him.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: And to m...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: ... and you knew about this.

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: All of a sudden, I'm supposed to drop out of school, forget my family, forget my career, forget all the plans I had for my life...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Well, forgive me for screwing up your plans!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'm sure glad I'm hearing all this now, before it's too late!

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: What is that sup...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: And what am I supposed to do with my life, huh? I am 28 years old! I work in a low-paying, low-status, zero-respect job which, unfortunately, I happen to fucking love.  How inconvenient.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: What a sweet little picture.  Mommy and Daddy aren't losing a daughter, they're gaining a eunuch!

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: Well, if that's the way you f...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Damn straight, it's how I feel! What's their wedding gift, a little gold collar that says "Mikey-poo"? Or do I have to change my name to "Binky"?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Fine.  I'm an insensitive, chauvinist asshole, and you're well rid of m...

turns.speaker: KIMMY
turns.text: MICHAEL!!

turns.speaker: MANDY
turns.text: Reverend Dyer, this is Kimberly's somewhat butch maid of honor...

turns.speaker: SAMMY
turns.text: ... Mr. Julianne Potter, prominent New York drag queen.

turns.speaker: SAMMY
turns.text: Kimberly wanted to tickle the grandmas, so we figured, give 'em a cheap thrill.  Walter supplied the decorative touches...

turns.speaker: SAMMY
turns.text: Nose tackle from the Bears... power forward from the Bulls... defenseman from the Black Hawks... my personal favorite, the designated hitter...

turns.speaker: MANDY
turns.text: ... I'm partial to the tight end.

turns.speaker: SAMMY
turns.text: This is USDA Prime, largely available, beef.  With no notice- able competition, present company excepted...

turns.speaker: SAMMY
turns.text: And yet here you are.  All celibate and reclusive.

turns.speaker: MANDY
turns.text: With those big, dark, haunted eyes. As if you were harborin' some... unspeakably... guilty... secret.

turns.speaker: SAMMY
turns.text: Maybe it's happy there.

turns.speaker: MANDY
turns.text: Oh the way out of the crab house? We asked Michael if we could see the ring?

turns.speaker: SAMMY
turns.text: He said you told him.  It'd be safer with you.

turns.speaker: MANDY
turns.text: An so it is.

turns.speaker: MANDY
turns.text: Personally, I think Mr.  Michael's marrying the wrong girl.

turns.speaker: SAMMY
turns.text: You're much more his type.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: You got the money?

turns.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
turns.text: Right here.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Well, don't lose it. Last time I gave you twenty-five dollars, you lost it.

turns.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
turns.text: Well, that just happened that time.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Well, it better not happen again.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: You lost twenty-five dollars once before that, too, near Christmas time -- I remember that real well now. December 9th, to be exact.

turns.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
turns.text: You got a real good memory, Star.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: I remember when I just saw you. Skinny Winnifred. Jesus, you were skinny.

turns.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
turns.text: What do you have to buy?

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Feed, mostly. Thought we'd get something for the kids.

turns.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
turns.text: Okay by me - I'd sure like to see that Opryland.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
turns.text: Grand Old Opera --

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: I hate that music.

turns.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
turns.text: I know that, Star.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Winifred.

turns.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
turns.text: Hi! Star.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Winifred, the kids want you home and so do I.

turns.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
turns.text: I won first prize.

turns.speaker: STAR
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: LINNEA
turns.text: You're from out of town?

turns.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
turns.text: Yes. I'm cutting a record.

turns.speaker: LINNEA
turns.text: We have a Bible study meeting tonight if you'd like to come.

turns.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
turns.text: Is there food?

turns.speaker: LINNEA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ALBUQUERQUE
turns.text: Well, I just wondered 'cause being from out or town I wouldn't be able to make anything.

turns.speaker: LINNEA
turns.text: No, those are socials you're thinking of... Saturday's usually.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: I called Connie and she said not to worry, She'll fill in for you.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: Barnett, please -

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: What's wrong honey.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: I don't want to listen to her sing -

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Don't feel that way, honey.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: Then why are you listening to her -

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Well, I have to go thank her for filling in and it's nice to know the tune she sang.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: You have to what?

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Go to the King Of the Road and thank her.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: Barnett?

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: Oh, Barnett, I'm so sorry.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Honey, it's okay... How do you feel now?

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: All those people...

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Don't worry, I'll take care or it

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: You're so good.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: Am I disturbing you?

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: I'm really all right, Barnett. Don't you worry really... I just don't want you to leave me that's all.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: Oh, honey, I didn't mean to scare you.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: How did you come in here?

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: Well, my wife, Ester's down the hall. I saw Barnett leaving and I was just talking to Ester about your being here.	She loves you so much, I just had to come down and say hello. We've been following you since you were a girl. Well, I just scared you to death. I didn't mean to do that.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: Well, I guess you caught me at a weak moment.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: You'll have to speak up.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: I said, I've been real tired.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: Eater  says she doesn't see how you do it.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: What's wrong with her.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: Oh just about everything, I guess. Those doctors started on an overhaul and don't want to quit. They keep taking things out. She's going to come home an egg shell. Tough, though.. She's tough.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: What did you say your name was?

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: Green.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: It's fine. We were just talking about Vitamin S.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: I'll go on. Ester'1l be very glad.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: You remember what I said about the Vitamins.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: You going today?

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: Thank you-- Yes, I am.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: I'll tell Ester, she'll be thrilled I saw you again.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: You get her those Vitamin E right away.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: I got them right here.

turns.speaker: BARBARA JEAN
turns.text: Well, Bye, Bye now. We have to go.

turns.speaker: GREEN
turns.text: Bye, Bye.

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: I'm sorry. I feel as if I know you. I'm John Triplette... a friend of Del Reese... I was at the airport. I just wanted to introduce myself. I'm a great fan of hers. If there's anything you need, just give me a call. I'm at the Sheraton South.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: She's going to rest now.

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: Okay, I just wanted to see if I could help out at all.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: I appreciate your concern, but she has to rest, so you can go on home.

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: Oh, sure.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: What do you really want?

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: Not a thing, Barnett, really. I need a little information. But, ah, it can wait.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: You bet.

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: Okay. Thanks.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: Barnett, John Triplette. How's she doing?

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: She's fine.

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: Well, I just thought I'd call.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Well, you did and she's fine. Thanks.

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: Well, that's not entirely true, Barnett. At least not according to Haven.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Haven? Hell,' we've been playing poker together since we were fourteen.

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: I guess that's why he thought you right want to help out.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: He knows better.

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: Well, it's probably because it would help him.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: How is that?

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: Everybody likes to be as good as their word.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Whose word?

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: His Word.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: His word? Are you telling me Haven promised you something?

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: That's pretty close. He's going to be on the bill. Why not put Barbara Jean on with him?

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: They can come to the concert in the park.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: I said 'no!'

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: I got trapped and you know it, so let's have some rules.

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: Absolutely. Listen, Barnett, I understand your position.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: No, you don't, so don't say you do. Bunch of damn liars. What do you get out or this?

turns.speaker: TRIPLETTE
turns.text: Nothing; Barnett. It's my job.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Your job, huh.

turns.speaker: REESE
turns.text: How is she?

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: A little slow, but she'll be fine.

turns.speaker: REESE
turns.text: Have you talked to Triplette?

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Who the hell is he?

turns.speaker: REESE
turns.text: He's lining up talent for Hal Phillip Walker.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Who the hell is he?

turns.speaker: REESE
turns.text: He's going to run for president.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Third party?

turns.speaker: REESE
turns.text: He has that sign with the tree.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: What does he want?

turns.speaker: REESE
turns.text: Barbara Jean.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: What!

turns.speaker: REESE
turns.text: That's what he wants.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: You know better than that.

turns.speaker: REESE
turns.text: It's on National television, Barnett.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: I don't care. She's always been neutral in politics and that's not going to change.

turns.speaker: REESE
turns.text: Well, how about the shopping center?

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Yes. She's pretty rested up.

turns.speaker: REESE
turns.text: Okay, then we'll see you there.

turns.speaker: BARNETT
turns.text: Okay.
